Revised, 1970 CHARLES F. GOSNELL, Grand Master LA VERNE W. GErMAN, Grand Marshal HOWARD W. Pcyrrs, Grand Lecturer Copyright, 1970 WENDELL K. WALKER, Grand Secretary 2 (This Ceremony is NOT open to the public) ORDER OF PROCESSION (In Column of Twos) GRAND MARSHAL AND/OR DEPUTY GRAND MARSHAL G~~r STAND A.RD BEARER WITH FlAG JUNIOR AND SENIOR GRAND DEACONS REPRESENTATIVES OF OTHER GRAND LODGES COMMITrEES GRAND DIRECTORS OF CEREMON[ES GRAND SWORD BEARERS GRAND STEWARDS Gs~~ CHAPLAINS DISmIcr DEPUTY GRAND MASTERS Co~IMISSIoNERS OF APPEALS FOUNDATION FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH TRUSTEES OF THE MASONIC HALL AND ASYLUM FUND PAST ELECTED GRAND LODGE OFF [CERS GRAND SECRETARY AND GRAND TREASURER JUNIOR AND SENIOR GRAND WARDENS DEPUTY GRAr~ MASTER Gi~i~ MASTER 3 ~w.stich rwstich rwstich rwstich rwstich rwstich rWStiCh rwstich rWStiCh rwstichi rWStiChl rwstichl rwstichl rwstichl rw.stichi tW.StiChl TWStiChI rw.sticht rw.sticht rwsticht TWStiCht tW.StiCht rwsticht rwsticht rwsticht iw.sticht iw.sticht iw.sticht rw.sticht rw.stichti IW.StiChti rw.stichti rw.stichti IW.StiChti rw.stichti rw.stichti rw.stichti IW.StiChti iw.stichti iW.StiChti rw.stichti rw.stichti rw.stichtii 1W .StiChtll iW.StiChtll iw.stichtii iW.StiChtIJ iw.stichtii

FLOOR PLAN 1. GRAND MASTER 7. GRAND MARSHAL 2. DEPUTY GRAND MASTER 8. GRAND CHAPLAIN 3. GRAND TREASURER 9. GRAND STEWARD 4. GRAND SECRETARY 10. GRAND STEWARD 5. SENIOR GRAND WARDEN 11. DISTRICT DEPUTY GRAND MASTER 6. JUNIOR GRAND WARDEN 12. CONSECRATION TABLE 13. GRAND LODGE OFFICERS NOT PARTICIPATING A. MASTER B. OFFICERS OF THE LODGE The Grand Master and his associate Grand Lodge Officers meet in a room of the Temple set apart for the use of Grand Lodge. The Brethren are seated in the Lodge room, the Officers of the Lodge occupying the Northeast corner. The Lodge is NOT OPEN and the stations and places are UN - OCCUPIED. Seats in the Southeast corner are reserved for the Grand Lodge Officers entering in procession but not otherwise participating in the Ceremony. The Grand Marshal enters the Lodge room, proceeds to the East and raises the Brethren. Grand Marshal: Brethren, The Most (Right) Worshipful (acting as) Grand Master of Masons in the State of New York, with his associate Grand Lodge Officers, is about to enter. The Grand Marshal returns to the ioom wheie the Grand Lodge Officers have assembled, and leads the procession into the Lodge room. The procession advances im~ mediately to the East, one column deploying toward the right, the other toward the left, facing inward, so the Grand Master may pass between the lines to the East escorted by the Grand Marshal, The Grand Standard Bearer with Flag takes a position West of the altar. 5 4 B 0 0 rwsticli rwsticli rwstich rwstich rwstich rw.stich iw.stich ivv.stich iw.stiCh rw.stich iw.stjch rw.stich rw,stich iW.stich~ rw.stich~ rw.stichi rw.stichi rw.stichi rw.stichl rw.stichl iw.stichl rw.sticht rw.sticht rw.sticht 1W sticht iwsticht iw.sticht iw.sticht iw.sticht iw.sticht vw.sticht vw.sticht vw.sticht] vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti 0 L~i 71

Grand Marshal: Brethren, The Most (Right) Worshipful (acting as) Grand Master of Masons in the State of New York. Grand Honors. Grand Master: Let no man enter upon any great or important undei - taking without first invoking the blessing of Almighty God. The Grand Chaplain will give the Invocation. Grand Chaplain: INVOCATION Brethren: So mote it be. Grand Master: Brethren, the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag. One verse of the Star Spangled Banner. (Optional) Grand Master: Right Worshipful Grand Marshal, escort the flag to the East. Grand Master: Right Worshipful Grand Marshal, escort the Right Worshipful Deputy Grand Master to his station. The Grand Master, using similar language, then orders the Grand Marshal to conduct individually, the Senior Grand Warden and the Junior Grand Warden to their 6 stations and the Grand Treasurer, the Grand Secretary and the Grand Chaplain and the two Grand Stewards to their places. He may also order the Grand Marshal to conduct the District Deputy Grand Master of the District, and Past Grand Masters to the East. Grand Master: The remaining Grand Lodge Officers will take seats among the Brethren. The Grand Master seats the Brethren. * MUSIC (Optional) The Master of the Lodge: Most Worshipful Grand Mastel, the Brethren of Lodge, No , being animated by a desire to promote the honor and interest of the Craft, have erected this Masonic Temple for their convenience and accom - modation. The building itself, the hall in which we are now assembled and the plan by which it has been conshucted having met with your approbation, we are desirous that this Temple be now solemnly dedicated to Masonic purposes agreeably to ancient Craft usage. Grand Master: Worshipful Brother , the officers of the Grand Lodge are greatly pleased to express to you and your Brethren the heartiest approval of this Temple and all the appointments. You and your Brethren are deserving of the highest commendation for this evidence of your deep attachment to the interests of the Craft, and pray that all who may come after you, and who shall be privileged to assemble 7 ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich rwstich rwstichi rwstichi rwstichi rwstichi rw.stichi w.stichi rw.stichl rw.stichi 1W, stichi iw.sticht IVV.sticht 1W. sticht rw.sticht rw.sticht rw.sticht iw.sticht ,w.sticht rw.sticht vw.sticht vw.sticht vw.sticht vw.stichti vw,stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichtii vw.stichtij vw.stichtii

within these walls may emulate your example and display equal, if not greater zeal, in the furtherance of the objectives of our Fraternity. The Master resumes his seat. Grand Master: Right Worshipful Junior Grand Warden, make announce - ment to the Brethten present, whose name it is, that we, as Freemasons, do honor most. Declare the first purpose to which this Temple is to be dedicated, and explain some of the principles which we exemplify in this Ceremony. Junior Grand Warden: Most Worshipful Grand Mastet, Brethren, the first duty of Masons is to God, because He is the Creator and the Rulet of all things and the Giver of all good. His name should never be absent from our minds, and all our doings should be with an eye to His glory, His praise and His approbation. All our ceremonies are intended to promote a reverence for Him, and to impress upon the novitiate the duties owing by man to Him. They are begun, conducted and ended to the glory of His gleat name. Therefore, in accordance with im - memorial custom, this Temple is to be dedicated in the name of the Great Jehovah. Freemasonry summarizes within itself all those good pur - poses to which this Temple is to be devoted. Embracing within its tenets virtue, charity~ ielief, brotherly love and affection, and above all constant and ieverent service to the Supreme Architect of the Universe, the institution of Free - masonry is itself the compendiu,rn of all the purposes to which the Temple should be dedicated. Therefore, not oniy will ancient Graft usage be followed, but the utmost propriety be observed when we shall dedicate this Temple to Freemasonry in the name of the Great Jehovah. Grand Master: Right Worshipful Grand Marshal, prepare the Symbolic Lodge for the dedicatory ceremony. The Symbolic Lodge stands upon a small table or pedestal between the A1~ar and the East, with sufficient open space surrounding it to admit of a procession, and having the vessels of corn, wine and oil upon the same pedestal or table. Up to this time the Symbolic Lodge and the vessels have remained covered with a white cloth. The Grand Marshal removes this cover and the Grand Steward at the left of the Senior Grand Warden and the Grand Steward at the left of the Junior Grand Warden come forward and stand west of the Altar. The Grand Master raises the Brethren. CONSECRATION Grand Chaplain: Almighty and ever-glorious and gracious Lord God; Creator of all things and Governor of everything that Thou hast made; mercifully look upon Thy servants, now assembled in Thy name and in Thy presence, bless and prosper all our works begun, continued and ended in Thee. Graciously be - stow upon us wisdom in all our doings, strength in all our difficulties, and the beauty of harmony and holiness in all our communications and work. Let faith be the foundation of our hope, and charity the fruit of our obedience to Thy revealed will. 0 Thou preserver of men, graciously enable us now to dedicate this house which we have erected to the honor and glory of Thy name, and be mercifully pleased to accept this service at our hands. 8 9 rwsticli rwstich rwstich rwstich rwstich ~w.stich rwstich ~w.stich rwstich rwstich rw.stich rwstich~ ‘w.stichi rw.stichi rw.stichi rw.stichi rw.stichi rw.stichl rw.stichi rw.sticht rw.sticht 1W. stichi 1W, sticht rw.sticht rw.sticht tw.sticht rw.sticht 1W .sticht iwsticht iw.sticht iw.sticht iw.sticht iw.sticht iw.stichti iw.stichti iw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti.

May all who shall be lawfully appointed to rule herein according to our Constitutions, be upder Thy special guid - ance and protection and faithfully observe and fulfill all their obligations to Thee and to the Lodge. May all who come within these consecrated walls have but one heart and one mind to love, to honor, to fear and to obey Thee as Thy majesty and unbounded goodness claim, and love one another as Thou hast loved us. May every dis - cordant passion be here banished from our bosoms, Here may we meet in Thy presence as a band of brethren created by the same Almighty Parent, duly sustained by the same bene - ficent hand, and traveling the same road through the gates of death. May we have here Thy holy word always present to mind, and here may religious virtue, love, harmony and peaceful joy reign triumphant in our hearts. May all the proper work of our Institution which may be perfoimed in this house be such as Thy wisdom may ap - prove and Thy goodness prosper. And finally, 0 Thou Sove- reign Architect of the Universe, be graciously pleased to bless the Masonic Craft wherever dispersed, and make them true and faithful to Thee, to their neighbors, and to themselves. And when the time of our labor shall draw neax to its end, and the pillars of our strength decline to the ground, enable us graciously, then, to pass through the valley of the shadow of death supported by Thy rod and Thy staff, to those mansions beyond the skies, where love and peace and joy forever reign before Thy throne. Amen. Brethren: So mote it be. * After the Consecration Prayer, the brethren aie seated by the Grand Master. 10 The Grand Marshal delivers the vessel of corn and the vessel of wine across the Altar to the Grand Stewards who convey them to the Junior and Senior Grand ‘Wardens respectively. The Grand Marshal carries the vessel of oil to the Deputy Grand Master in the East. The Grand Chaplain descends from the East for the first perambulation and marches once around the Symbolic Lodge beginning at the West. During the perambulation he recites the following Scripture, after which he stands at the south side of the Symbolic Lodge. FIRST PERAMBULATION Grand Chaplain: And the word of the Lord came to Solomon, saying: Concerning this house which thou art in building, if thou wilt walk in my statutes, and execute my judgments, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I perform my word, with thee, which I spake unto David thy father; And I will dwell among the children of Isiael, and will not forsake my people Israel. So Solomon built the house and finished it. (i Kings 6:11-14) At the conclusion of the perambulation the Junior Grand Warden rises in his station. Junior Grand Warden: Most Worshipful Grand Master, in the dedication of Masonic Temples it has been the immemorial custom to pour xx ‘w.sticli ‘w.sticli ‘w.sticli ‘w.sticli ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich rwstich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich’ 1W.StiCh 1W.StiChl 1W.StiCbl 1W.StiChl wsticbi iw.stichi w.stichi 1W.StiChl 1W.sticht 1W.Sticht 1W.sticht 1W.StiCht ;w.sticht ;w.sticht tw.sticht 1W.StiCht vw.sticht vw.sticht vw.sticht vw.sticht vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichtii vw.stichtii

corn upon the Lodge as an emblem of nourishment. I there - fore present this vessel of corn to be employed by you agree - ably to ancient Graft usage. The Junior Grand Warden then delivers the vessel of corn to his Grand Steward who carries it W’est of the Altar and presents it to ihe Grand Marshal. The Grand Marshal carries the vessel to the Grand Master in the East who calls the brethren ~o their feet. Grand Master: In the name of the Great Jehovah, to whom be all honor, glory and praise, I , Giand Master of Masons in the State of New York, (or I acting by virtue of a dispensation from, and therefore in the name and the stead of Most Worshipful Grand Master of Masons in the State of New York), d~ solemnly dedicate this Temple to Freemasonry. The Grand Master descends from the East escorted by the Grand Marshal and pours the corn upon the Symbolic Lodge. Grand Master: May the corn of nourishment ever be vouchsafed to all who shall gather within these walls. Amen. Biethren: So mote it be. The Grand Master returns to the East escorted by the Grand Marshal. 22 Grand Marshal: Brethren, Grand Honois. The Grand Master seats the brethren. * Grand Master: Right Worshipful Senior Grand Warden to what other purposes may this Temple be dedicated, and in whose name? Senior Grand Warden: Most Worshipful Grand Master, from the very earliest days it has been the custom to dedicate Masonic Temples in the name of the Great Jehovah; but for centuries the custom has obtained to dedicate them also to the memory of the Holy Saints John. And while Freemasonry does within itself em - brace and inculcate all virtues, yet as our Ritual ofttimes dis - plays one object lesson and then another to teach the same tiuth or emphasize the same instruction, so it has long been the custom among Freemasons to emphasize the teachings of the Craft by dedicating their Lodge Rooms to virtue. SECOND PERAMBULATION The Grand Chaplain marches twice around the Symbolic Lodge during which he recites the following Scripture; Grand ChapJam: For he cast two pillars of brass, of eighteen cubits high apiece; and a line of twelve cubits did compass either of them about. 13 ‘w.stich rwsticli rwstich rwstich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich fW.StiCh ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich ‘w.stich’ ‘w.stichi rw.stichi rw.stichi ‘w.stichi ~w,siich~ ‘w.stichi ‘wstlchi ‘w.stichi ‘w.stichl ~w.sticht ‘w.sticht ‘w.stlcht ~w.s~icIit iw.sticht w.s(iclit rw.sticht rw.sticht ~w.sticht ,w.sticht w.sticht /w.sticht ~w.stichti ,w.sticht, iw.stichti iw.stichti iw.stichti vw.stichti iw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti vw.stichti w.stichti ~w stichti

And he made two chapiters of molten brass, to set upon the tops of the pillars: the height of the one chapiter was five cubits, and the height of the other chapiter was five cubits: And nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for the chapiters which were upon the top of the pillars; seven foi the one chapiter and seven for the other chapiter. (r Kings 7:15-17) At the conclusion of the second perambulation the Senior Grand ‘Warden ri9es in his station: Senior Grand Warden: Most Worshipful Grand Master, wine, the emblem of re - freshment, having been used by our ancient Brethren in the dedication and consecration of their Lodges, I present this vessel of wine to be used by you on this occasion, agreeably to ancient Craft usage. The Senior Grand Warden delivers the vessel of wine to his Grand Steward who carries it West of the Altar and presents it to the Grand Marshal. The Grand Marshal carries the vessel to the Grand Master in the East who calls the brethren to their feet. Grand Master: In the name of the Holy Saints John, I do solemnly dedicate this Temple to Virtue. The Grand Master decends from the East, escorted by the Grand Marshal and pours the wine upon the Symbolic Lodge. 14 Giand Master: May the Fountain of all Strength constantly rcfrcsh those who shall here assemble and vouchsafe to them strength for the perfect performance of all those things which ought here to be done. Amen. Brethren: So mote it be. Tho Grand Master rcturns to the East Marsbal. escorted by the Grand Grand Marshal: Brethren, Grand Honors twice. * The Grand Master seats the Brethren. Grand Master: Right Worshipful Deputy Grand unto the Brethren the significance of consecration and dedication. Master, make known the third element of Deputy Grand Master: Brethren, Freemasonry is neither bound by geographical lines, nor circumscribed by race, creed or time. All Free - masons, whencesoever they may come, so long as this Temple shall stand, will here find welcome and brotherly greeting. Within these walls will be taught the doctrine that “hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth,” wherefore all men are brethren, children alike of one Father and members of one family. It will here be taught that wheresoever destitution exists, there also it is Masonic duty to relieve. For though we are reminded that brethren are especially to be considered, nevertheless every ‘w.stich ‘w.stlch ‘w.stlch w.stich w.stICI~ w,stleIi ‘w.stieli w.stlcli w.sticli ~W,MiCh w,siich w.stleh ~w.sti~h ‘w.stlcli w.stich ~w.stich ‘w.stlch ‘w.stich ‘w.stiOIi ‘w.stloh ‘w.stich ‘w.stich rwstich ‘w.stich ‘w,stlch ‘w,slloh ‘w.stI~Ii ~w .s(kli ‘w.Sti~li ~w.stlch rw.stich ~w.stich ‘w.~tICh ~w.sticii rw.stlch rw.sti~Ii ~w.stich rw.stich ~w.stlch ~w.stich ,ws(ich ~w.stich ~w.stich rw.stich w.stich ,w such w such

Entered Apprentice has impressed upon him the duty of affording relief to any deserving member of the human family. Even as our ancient Grand Master, Solomon, King of Israel, in his dedicatory prayer upon the completion of the Great Temple, invoked Divine blessing not only upon the children of Israel, but also upon all the strangers from foreign lands who might thereafter tum their faces towards Jerusalem, so Freemasons have ever dedicated their Lodge Rooms to Uni - versal Benevolence in the name of the entire Fraternity. THIRD PERAMBULATION The Grand Chaplain marches thrice around the Symbolic Lodge duxing which he recites the following Scripture: Grand Chaplain: And Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven: And he said, LORD God of Israel, there is no God like thee, in heaven above, or on earth beneath, who keepest cove - nant and mercy with thy servants that walk before thee with all their heart: Who hast kept with thy servant David my father that thou promisedst him: thou speakest also with my mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as it is this day. Therefore now, LORD God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that thou promisedst him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel; so that thy children take heed to their way, that they walk before me as thou hast walked before me. i6 r And now, 0 God of Israel, let thy wuid, I p~y lucy’, b~ verified, which thou spakest uuiio iiiy NC’IviIlli I )siv~d uiiy r~iilici:. (i Kings 8:22-29) At the conclusion of the third perambulation the Deputy Grand Master rises in his station and presents the vessel of oil to the Grand Master. Grand Master: In the name of the entire Fratemity, wheresoever dis - persed upon this terrestrial globe, I do now solemnly dedicate this Temple of Universal Benevolence. The Grand Master, escorted by the Grand Marshal, steps to the Symbolic Lodge and pours the oil thereon. Grand Master: N’Iay the oil of joy be diffused over the hearts of all the distressed, and may our Fraternity be inspired to such deeds of benevolence as shall prove a constant joy to all mankind. Amen. Brethren: So mote it be. The Grand Master returns to the East, escorted by the Grand Maishal. Grand Marshal: Brethren, Grand Honors thrice. The Grand Chaplain stands at the East end of the Symbolic Lodge and offers the following praycr: Grand Chaplain: And may the LORD, the giver of every good and perfect gift, bless the brethren here assembled, in all their lawtnl undertakings, and grant to each of them, in needful supply, the corn of nourishment, the wine of refreshment and the oil of joy. Amen. I V Brethren: So mote it be. The Grand Mastcr sc’aI,~ !li@ l2r~IiIrcll, The Grand Tljrslia’I coven the Symbolic ~ * Tiw O’alId M~lStCj calls the brethren to their feet. Grand Master: Right Woishipful Grand Marshal, make the proclama - tion. The Grand Marshal proceeds to the South. Grand Marshal: In the name of the Grand Lodge of Free and Accepted Masons of the State of New York, and by the order of the Most (Right) Worshipful , (acting as) Grand Master, I proclaim this Temple of Lodge, No , dedicated to Freemasonry, agreeably to ancient Craft usage and in ample form. The Grand Marshal proceeds to thc West. www.stichtingnrgl IS vw.stichtingargus.nl www.stichtingargus.nl www.stichtingargus.nl www.stichtingargus n I www.stichtingargl IS The Grand Marshal proceeds to the East. Grand Marshal: To the Glory of the Grand Architect of the Universe. In the name of the Grand Lodge of Free and Accepted Masons of the State of New York, and by order of the Most (Right) Worshipful , (acting as) Grand Master, I proclaim this Temple of Lodge, No , dedicated to Freemasonry, Virtue and Uni - versal Benevolence, agreeably to ancient Craft usage and in ample form. Brethren, Grand Honors. Grand Master: Right Worshipful Grand Marshal, escort the Worshipful Master to the East. The Grand Master places the Gavel in the hands of the Master of the Lodge. Grand Marshal: Brethren, The Most Worshipful Grand Master, with his Grand Lodge associates, is about to retire. You will remain under the diiection of the Worshipful Master. The Grand Master escorted by the Grand Marshal, and fol - lowed by the Grand Lodge Officers, will then retire. The Lodge may then proceed with the program of the evening. 20
